security: This document contains sensitive intelligence sources and methods, and is not releasable to foreign nationals or contractors. Quoting directly: “SENSITIVE INTELLIGENCE SOURCES AND METHODS INVOLVED—NOT RELEASABLE TO FOREIGN NATIONALS. NOT RELEASABLE TO CONTRACTORS OR CONTRACTOR/CONSULTANTS--DISSEMINATION AND EXTRACTION OF INFORMATION CONTROLLED BY ORIGINATOR.”
summary: FBI HQ relays information from a source in Jamaica that a Cuban diplomat, Enrique Montero, alleged Cuban exiles, including former Cuban Air Force officer Diaz Lanz, were involved in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy during a Communist Party meeting in the Cuban Embassy.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 20, 1977, the FBI HQ sent a memo to DOJ/CRIM regarding allegations made by Enrique Montero, Minister-Counselor of the Cuban Embassy in Kingston, Jamaica, who claimed that Cuban exiles, including Diaz Lanz, were involved in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. Montero made these allegations on September 24, 1977, during an address to a monthly meeting of the Communist Party of Cuba members assigned to Jamaica, stating that recent information implicated Diaz in the Kennedy assassination, made in the context of increased counter-revolutionary activities by Cuban exiles.
title: HSCA ADMINISTRATIVE FOLDER, ASSASSINATION MATTERS VOLUME XII
